SENT.plain: High dose acetaminophen (HDAC) with N-acetylcysteine (NAC) has been effective in adults with advanced malignancies
We report HDAC with NAC in a child with progressive hepatoblastoma, confirmed at biopsy of an unresectable hepatic mass
Alpha-fetoprotein (AFP) increased despite four courses of doxorubicin and one course of cisplatin, 5-flurouracil, and vincristine
Following HDAC with NAC, AFP markedly decreased
A continued response without toxicity was observed during four subsequent courses of HDAC with NAC and cisplatin
The residual necrotic tumor was resected
The child is now over 8 years disease free
HDAC and NAC are effective and well tolerated for progressive hepatoblastoma
